question: The load line is defined by the ________ and a characteristic curve is defined by the ________.
The slope of the load line depends on the ________.
The combination of a short circuit in series with an open circuit always results in a(n) ________ circuit.
The quiescent point (Q-point) is defined by a(n) ________.
A diode is in the ________ state if the current established by the applied sources is such that its direction matches that of the arrow in the diode symbol and VD > 0.7 V.
The x-intercept of the load line with the characteristic curve is determined by the ________.
C: source voltage and the load resistor

question: A germanium diode is approximated by ________ equivalent for voltages less than 0.3 V.
A clamping network must have ________.
With the Zener diode in the "on" state, increasing IL will ________ IZ and ________IR.
C: decrease, keep the same level of
D: increase, keep the same level of

question: A Zener diode is in a ________ impedance region in the forward bias while it has a ________ impedance region in the reverse bias.
The full-wave voltage doubler provides ________ filtering action than (as) the half-wave voltage doubler.
Once the Zener diode is in the "on" state, VZ is always ________ VL.
The absence of the Si or Ge and VD label on a diode denotes ________ notation.
Zener diodes are used in regulator networks to ________.
C: maintain a fixed voltage across the load resistor

question: For the ideal diode the transition between states will occur at the point on the characteristic curve when VD = ________ V and ID = ________ A.

In this voltage multiplier, measuring from the top of the transformer winding will provide ________ multiples of Vm at the output, whereas measuring the output voltage from the bottom of the transformer will provide ________ multiples of the peak Vm.
For the "off" state of a Zener diode, the voltage across the diode should be ________.
C: less than V<sub>Z</sub> but greater than zero

question: The intersection of the load line with the characteristic curve determines the ________ of the system.
The dc voltage level of a silicon diode is ________ its ideal model.
As the load resistor increases, the slope of the dc load line and the levels of diode current ________.
The source voltage must be ________ the voltage drop across the diode to conduct the diode.
The process of removing one-half the input signal to establish a dc level is called ________.
The ratio of the total swing of the output of a clamper to its input total swing is ________.
The PIV rating of the diodes in a full-wave rectifier must be larger than ________ Vm.

In a half-wave voltage doubler, the voltage across output capacitor C2 drops across the load during the ________ half cycle and the capacitor is recharged up to ________ during the ________ half cycle.
